column5: Sorry to hear about your losses   Looks like your friend is using an Abu STX. How does he like it? Those ciscos look a lot like smelt...It's the first time I see ciscos in a photograph. Cool.
That's the plan.  We didn't touch the steelhead population on Sunday, lol!!!
Very sorry about your Mom and your friend Dave. I hope your Dad is getting through ok.
Woow so sorry to hear about the tradgic turn of events... I do think your on the right track to recovery..Our thoughts and prayers go your way....Great fish too! That one laker is a hog..nice
My condolences Dave...

Last Monday I got back from my annual 6 week trip to Alaska (report to come) and on Thurday my dad phones and tells me mom is very ill in the hospital and not expected to make it. I quickly booke a flight (I leave on Monday for Ontario) and call dad on Friday evening only to find out she passed on that afternoon).  I made plans to get out for some fishing before heading to Ontario to help take my mind off things. Then this morning I wake up to a bunch of messageson the computer only to find out a good buddy died Friday night. I can't beleive I lost my mom and a good friend in the space of 12 hours!!!  Well my buddy and I head to the lake this morning and finally things start to change. We head up the lake to do a little trolling for pike and lakers and plan to head to the river later and dip some ciscoes as the run is on and my bait stocks are running low.  The north of the lake is where we plan to start and it was a good choice as we landed 4 lakers and about a dozen pike. I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. Enjoy.                Got Bait?      Next stop Pearson Intl. Airport. I plan to hit up some steelies since I have to fly East.
My condolences on the loss of your Mother and your Bud, Dave.
Condolences Dave....
prayers from our family to yours
My condolences.
my condolences, .
Good stuff buddy, looking forward to seeing you.
Sorry to here that Dave,my condolences...
sorry for your loss
Condolences Dave.
sorry to hear that news dave...it kind of over shadows your awesome fishing report..hope things get better
That is a rough stretch--sorry to hear of this news
Sorry to hear about your losses...never easy that's for sure.
Sorry for the loss of your mother and friend Dave
Man, thats a tough go for sure. Thoughts go out to you and your family!

sorry for your losses...  great report tho...  do you use the ciscoes for ice fishing?  im a bit overstocked with big bait (9-12 inches) for musky...and was gunna freeze some for ice fishing... do you add anything in the baggy? or just the bait?

Yep, I use them for ice fishing and spring fishing for pike and lakers.  I usually just stuff them in freezer bags. I'm also going to start brining them using this recipe before tossing them in the freezer. I'll probably do it with these when I get back home at the end of the month.
Sorry to hear of your losses but thanks a bunch for that link. Going to try that.
Very sorry to hear of your losses Dave, very rough time I'm sure. My condolences to you and your family. Good to see you got out and did what I'm sure they would want you to be doing.
Sorry for your loss, hopefully you have good memories to keep you going.
Definitely a rough week...sorry for you loss...thanks for sharing the news with the folks here, and I have to say, I like your kind of therapy....nice fish!
Sorry to hear about your mom Dave   Hopefully we'll hookup while you're down here.
Sorry to hear the bad news.
God Bless your Mother Dave.  Sincerest condolences,  Simon
Thankyou all for your wishes and prayers.  Bill, talk to Mike and see to it that we get together. There be some steelies that need to be caught.
